history.content:
It's always a good idea to enroll in many classes and drop once you get a feel for them. Also, taking summer classes will usually make your schedule less packed in the long run.

CS162 over summer is hell. The projects are already almost back-to-back in normal course offerings, so they're even more accelerated during the summer. I've had two friends do that and it wasn't great for them. You will likely not be able to do much with your upper elective if you take it in the summer.

My impression is that Option 1 is avoiding any of the classes with higher workload. I think you shouldn't avoid classes with a reputation of being hard, but plan your schedule around them. I don't think you should take option 2; CS162 over the summer as hell as I said, and CS164 can be tough; it would be better to take that as the sole technical rather than with 168. I think option 3 is the most balanced option, since CS161 is not as high of a workload as CS162, and you take CS164 as the sole technical. Spring semester might be tough, though.


Besides that, do whatever you think is best for your situation and education goals. I can only give general advice about course scheduling since I don't know your situation well.

I'm wondering about which upper divs I should take for my last year at Cal. I made some options below but any other recommendations would be nice too!

Note that I am a disabled student so I can take less than 13 units per semester. I'm in Letters&Science CS and upper divs I've already taken are 170, 188, and 186. So, I just need 8 units of upper division CS/EE/EECS courses and 8 units of upper div tech electives (which could include CS courses).

I've been undecided of whether I should take an "easier" courseload (since I've been easily stressed out and burnt out by classes due to mental health reasons) or a "harder" courseload but with possibly more relevant classes.

I would like the classes to be evenly/lightly paced so I don't get too overwhelmed. 

Options:

  • Option 1 (probably the easier courseload)
    1. Summer: None,
    2. Fall: CS161, Data100
    3. Spring: Info159, CS168, 3 unit upper div outside major
  • Option 2
    1. Summer: CS162, 2 unit upper div elective outside major
    2. Fall: CS161, CS164
    3. Spring: CS168, 1 unit upper div elective outside major
  • Option 3
    1. Summer: CS161, 2 unit upper div elective outside major
    2. Fall: CS164, 1 unit upper div elective outside major
    3. Spring: CS162, CS168
history.subject: What upper divs to take for last year in Cal?
